intro: Sarcocolla acuta, commonly known as the sharp-sheath bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, green, ovate leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces tiny, pinkish-white flowers with distinctive spurred petals, which are adapted for pollination by small insects. Sarcocolla acuta thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its unique morphology and specialized adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
